senses.de: To discover or perceive the existence or presence of something
senses.ex: She detected a hint of sarcasm in his voice.

Tips.title: Subtle Discovery
Tips.description: Detect often signals discovering something not obvious at first glance.
Tips.example: Upon rereading the text, I detected an underlying theme of redemption.

Tips.title: Emotional Nuance
Tips.description: Detect can imply a level of sensitivity when noticing subtle emotions.
Tips.example: He could detect the disappointment in her faint smile.

senses.de: Identify a specific characteristic or detail of something
senses.ex: The virus is difficult to detect in the early stages of infection.

Tips.title: Technical Contexts
Tips.description: Use detect when referring to identifying specifics using tools or skills; often used in medical or technical contexts.
Tips.example: The laboratory equipment detected traces of lead in the sample.

Tips.title: First Indications
Tips.description: Detect is used when describing the first signs or early stages of something.
Tips.example: Doctors can now detect the disease much earlier than before.

senses.de: Discover or investigate a crime or wrongdoing
senses.ex: The police were able to detect the crime because of the evidence left at the scene.

Tips.title: Crime Discovery
Tips.description: In a legal context, detect emphasizes the uncovering of criminal activity, often through investigation.
Tips.example: The forensic team detected signs of tampering at the crime scene.

Tips.title: Investigative Skill
Tips.description: Detect suggests a skill or ability to notice what is not easily noticed by others, highlighting expertise.
Tips.example: The detective's trained eye detected the hidden compartment.

senses.de: To notice or discern something with the senses
senses.ex: Taste buds can detect five different kinds of taste.

Tips.title: Sensory Perception
Tips.description: Use detect for what is directly noticed by the senses, such as sight, hearing, or smell.
Tips.example: She detected a faint odor in the room that reminded her of pine trees.

Tips.title: Implicit Contrast
Tips.description: Detecting implies there is some difficulty or need for attention to notice something.
Tips.example: The hunter detected slight movement in the brush, signaling nearby game.

Discern.wordDefinition:
Discern means to perceive or recognize something, often using intuition or careful observation. For example, a person with a discerning palate can taste and distinguish between different flavors and ingredients in a dish.

Discern can also be used to mean understanding the true nature or meaning of something, such as discerning the motives behind someone's actions.

Detect is more commonly associated with finding something through scientific or mechanical means, while discern is more associated with understanding or perceiving something using intuition or careful observation.

Discover.wordDefinition:
Discover means to come across something new or previously unknown that was hidden or not visible before. For example, Christopher Columbus discovered America in 1492.

Overall, while both words entail finding something, detect refers to finding something through investigation or observation, while discover refers to finding something new.

Identify.wordDefinition:
Identify means to recognize or name something that you already know or are familiar with. For example, you can identify a person you know or a plant species you have studied.

Detect is used when you're trying to find something that might be hidden or not noticeable at first, while identify is used when you're trying to recognize or name something you already know.

Locate.wordDefinition:
Locate means to find the exact position or place of something. For example, a GPS device can locate a person's current location on a map.

Detect is used to identify the presence of something, while locate is used to find the exact location of something.

Notice.wordDefinition:
Detect means to discover or find something that is not easily noticeable or visible, often through careful observation or analysis.

Notice means to become aware of or pay attention to something that is easily noticeable, often through one's senses.

For example, a person may notice the smell of food cooking in the kitchen or notice a friend waving at them from across the room.

Detect is applicable when looking for something that is hidden or not easily seen or heard, while notice is applicable when something is easily seen or heard and catches your attention.

Perceive.wordDefinition:
Perceive means to understand or interpret something through one's senses or intuition. It is a more nuanced concept than detection, requiring a level of interpretation and understanding.

For example, you might perceive a subtle change in your friend's mood based on their body language and tone of voice. Perceiving does not necessarily require an external stimulus, as it is more closely tied to cognitive processing.

Overall, detecting is about noticing and uncovering something while perceiving is about making sense of that discovery.

Spot.wordDefinition:
Both detect and spot mean to notice or identify something.

Spot often refers to quickly noticing something obvious, like a stain on a shirt or an animal in the wild. In simpler terms, detect is used for finding something hidden or hard to find, while spot is used for quickly seeing something out in the open.

Uncover.wordDefinition:
Uncover means to reveal or expose something that was previously unknown, hidden or secret.

Thus, detect is used when we are looking for something that is not easily visible to the naked eye, while uncover is used when we want to reveal something that has been intentionally hidden or covered up.

quotes.Text: The CIA in real life, we know, is looking for new kinds of cover. It's looking for new platforms, as they like to say, and it's trying to use the revolution in communications technology, the ability to use all sorts of corporate entities in ways that are hard to detect to get our spies in the places where they need to be.
quotes.Title: American Journalist
quotes.Name: David Ignatius

quotes.Text: Doctors and nurses, with their training and their experiences, they would be able to detect unusual patterns of disease. That's why we say it is important for every country to have a proper surveillance system. The function of the surveillance system is to detect unusual patterns of diseases.
quotes.Title: Chinese Public Servant
quotes.Name: Margaret Chan

quotes.Text: We can detect very small differences in telomere length, and it is a very simple and fast technique where many samples can be analysed at the same time. Most importantly, we are able to determine the presence of dangerous telomeres - those that are very short.
quotes.Title: Spanish Scientist
quotes.Name: María Blasco Marhuenda

quotes.Text: We're at a point now where we've built AI tools to detect when terrorists are trying to spread content, and 99 percent of the terrorist content that we take down, our systems flag before any human sees them or flags them for us.

quotes.Name: Mark Zuckerberg

quotes.Text: Regions' role in detecting and developing a raw talent is no secret, as they work so hard to produce top class players who go on to represent departments, then national team, and also play in different leagues of the world.

quotes.Text: When I thought about having the greatest impact with my life, I thought about all the times people lose loved ones because diseases weren't detected early enough. I thought, 'I can play a role there.

quotes.Text: But as you said, there are going to be those that have no record and cannot be detected in that capacity so that is why you have to have other layers of security.

quotes.Text: Perhaps, after all, America never has been discovered. I myself would say that it had merely been detected.

quotes.Text: Sometimes when we are generous in small, barely detectable ways it can change someone else's life forever.
quotes.Title: American Comedian
quotes.Name: Margaret Cho

quotes.Text: It's important for the Fed, hard as it is, to attempt to detect asset bubbles while they're forming.

quotes.Name: Janet Yellen
